pull.title: Fix some locks
pull.body:
This makes sure that cs_filter is never held while taking cs_main or CNode::cs_vSend.

This should fix #8599.

events.message:
Fix some locks

This makes sure that cs_filter is never held while taking cs_main
or CNode::cs_vSend.

events.body: I believe this bug was introduced in 0.13.0.
Feel like testing whether this fixes your issue #8599, @jonasschnelli ?

I just ran again into #8599...
Added this PR on top of current master and re-started the node... will report.

My node having the issue #8599 did run without deadlock assertion-exit the last 7 days.
Testes ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8606/commits/144ed76ea0b38b7c21b224501964f8a2c65c4bb6

issue.title: Do not shadow upper local variable 'send', prevent -Wshadow compiler warning.
issue.body:
Fixes new `-Wshadow` (#8105) warning from #8606:

```
Making all in src
  CXX      libbitcoin_server_a-main.o
main.cpp:4792:30: warning: declaration shadows a local variable [-Wshadow]
                        bool send = false;
                             ^
main.cpp:4748:22: note: previous declaration is here
                bool send = false;
                     ^
1 warning generated.
```

It would be nice to get rid of it completely and sending `merkleblock` only when something like `merkleBlock.initialized()`, but there is no getter now and all properties are marked as `public` only for unit testing.

issue.title: NCC-2016-006 - Lock Order Inversion
issue.body: We're currently assessing impact before publishing more detail.

issue.title: [P2P] Begin Network Encapsulation
issue.body:
This is the finalization of the upstream PRs being tracked in #1374 to update much of our networking code to more closely follow upstream improvements. The following PRs are included here:

- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8466
  Do not shadow variables in networking code
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8606
  Fix some locks
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8085
  Begin encapsulation
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9289
  drop boost::thread_group
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8740
  No longer send local address in addrMe
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8661
  Do not set an addr time penalty when a peer advertises itself

Additionally, during conflict resolution and backporting of 8085, the following additional upstream PR was included:
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8715
  only delete CConnman if it's been created


Still TODO in future PRs:
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9037
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9441
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9609
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9626
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9708
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12381
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18584

issue.title: Bitcoin 0.14 locking PRs
issue.body:
These are locking changes from upstream (bitcoin core) release 0.14, oldest to newest (when merged to the master branch).

Each commit also includes a reference both to the PR and the upstream commit.

- bitcoin/bitcoin#8472
- bitcoin/bitcoin#8606
  - Excludes a lock move because we don't have bitcoin/bitcoin#7840 which this move was partially-reverting.
- bitcoin/bitcoin#9230
  - Only first commit (we don't have `LogTimestampStr` anymore).
- bitcoin/bitcoin#9243
  - Only the sixth commit, excluding `IsArgSet` locking (we haven't pulled that function in yet).
- bitcoin/bitcoin#9626
  - The cherry-picked commit does not match the upstream at all, but the resulting lock is useful.
- bitcoin/bitcoin#9679
- bitcoin/bitcoin#9227
- bitcoin/bitcoin#9698
  - Excludes change to `CConnman::PushMessage` in second commit (which we don't have yet).
- bitcoin/bitcoin#9708
- bitcoin/bitcoin#9771
